website_summaries.verdict: The Western Digital MyBook Live is a fast, plug-and-play, simple-to-use home NAS server that unfortunately lacks features and has a subpar remote-access solution.
pros: The Western Digital My Book Live NAS server is easy to use, fast, and affordable
It also comes with mobile applications to share photos on the go
cons: The WD My Book Live's hard drive can't be serviced by users, and there's no USB port to add more storage
The device lacks common features found in many NAS servers, and its MioNet remote access solution is nearly useless

customer_reviews.title: Never worked right
customer_reviews.text: It sounds like a nice idea; 2TB of data sitting on your home network that you can map as a drive on all your windows computers; save all your photos and important documents which can be accessed from any location. However, it has never worked this way. Windows 7 periodically lost connection, and now windows 10 can not even see it. I have opened sever tickets with Western Digital over the years but their customer service is terrible. They have never supported this product and now I'm just out of luck. My only recourse is to buy a new device or build my own NAS. I will NEVER buy another western digital device.
customer_reviews.author: Geeky Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best hard drive I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: It just died ... after over 7 years of performing flawlessly. I've never had any hard drive last that long and that's worth something, right? It was missing features I wish it had, and it had its limitations, but for what it did - function as a hard drive accessible on a home network - it did great and it did it for a long time. I don't know if the newer versions will live up to my experience with this one, but I hope so.
customer_reviews.author: John Seven

customer_reviews.title: Fast, durable, long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item years ago and forgot to do a review. Years later I still have it up and running. I’ve never had an issue with it. It stays cool, holds all of my movies and tv shows, transfers very well with the internet. Very sturdy case and looks great on the tv stand. Connects to my Xbox and PlayStation as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Pier

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Enough features. The backup software for Windows works well enough. I have had it running non-stop since I have had it except for vacation and long power outages. I have it connected (with my wireless router and DSL modem) to a small battery backup unit. That may be the reason it has worked so well for me, but I cannot recommend strongly enough that at least the NAS drive be connected to a backup unit if it is to run 24/7 365. UPDATE: It still works like new. It runs 24/7 365. I only turn it off when we go on vacation; so it keeps spinning away about 51 weeks every year.
customer_reviews.author: Tiberius

customer_reviews.title: Great for light home use, works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for someone who wants to store some family photos, extra music, or any other digital file. Plugs into the network, and it's easy to access. Really happy with everything. Of course, nothing replaces a RAID system with multiple drives that can be located in a closet or something like that. I wish I had the money for that, but this works for now. Just make sure to back up your backup drive. Seems redundant, but these things have a tendency to just quit, and then you say "I wish I had backed up my computer instead of going to that Halloween party!."
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: This worked fine for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine for 2 years, then without warning stopped working completely. I called Tech Support they were not helpful. They told me it's just dead and there is nothing they can do. That there may have been a power surge, but this thing was plugged into a surge protector. And that they don't do data recovery of the countless priceless pictures and files that were on this thing. Tech Support guy seemed annoyed that I'm upset. He says that I shouldn't be using it without a backup! Oh yeah. It's my fault that they make a piss poor product that fails.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would give this item zero stars if I could,
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start, -set up page has been taken down. They didn't even bother to add a re-direct. -multiple calls to tech support to perform Firmware updates + software updates -Set up instruction manual does not match screens. Absolutely ZERO tabs to perform a backup. -Absolutely nothing matched up. This device is supposed to performs backups but you can't find a backup menu to save your life. -my opinion, RUN do not walk from this obsolete garbage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Suitable for TimeMachine Backups
customer_reviews.text: Otherwise great specs & it is a great network drive. Backed up 1st Win7 laptop using SmartWare fine but 2d one never completed initial data set correctly. I bought it specifically for TimeMachine backup w/OS X 10.8 on a late model MacBook Pro. WiFi backup was extremely slow (over 4 days for 250GB) and then got Verification Error messages after 15-20 days. Switched to Ethernet & initial backup went much faster but never got more than 28 days before it errored out again & required new backup. Spent countless hours w/WD senior techs & more w/Apple senior techs trying to diagnose & solve problem. All tried to be helpful but w/o success. WD even replaced drive, but same result.
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: I'll definitely will not buy nor recommend a WD product ever again
customer_reviews.text: This is my third WD drive, and the third time I lose ALL my information; the disks just stop working one day, all of the sudden, without any chance to recover the data. The first two just stopped working altogether, now this one the Ethernet port seems dead hence cannot be accessed without becoming a hardware technician or expending a lot of money in data recovery services. I'll definitely will not buy nor recommend a WD product ever again.
customer_reviews.author: MAHE

customer_reviews.title: Went kaput after 18 months; slow access speeds
customer_reviews.text: 18 months after buying this drive, it has crashed and is no longer accessible. Because it is only accessible by router, without tearing it apart to connect the actual hard drive to a local PC, there's no way to diagnose it or reformat the drive. While it may be fine for general backup, I found it very frustrating to be able to transfer files to it (and retrieve files from it) at the much slower rates you get over your wifi network -- nothing like the speed of even USB 2 cables. Assuming I can fix this drive, I'll use it purely as an emergency backup drive. No more looking to it for frequent access.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Bristow

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it.
customer_reviews.text: After spending several days and multiple sessions with WD technical support, we could never get this drive to operate fast enough. Even connected directly to my MacBook Pro via ethernet cable, file transfer speeds lagged in a big way. Once, after reformatting the drive and starting from zero, the transfer speed increased significantly for a short time, but then went back down to a trickle. WD wanted to blame my router, but not much improved when we bypassed the router and connected directly. I'm bummed this didn't work out because this drive seems like a great idea for an out-of-site and out-of-mind back-up. But back to Amazon it goes.
customer_reviews.author: splice35mm

customer_reviews.title: My Mistakes
customer_reviews.text: Concept is excellent,execution is not. I had great difficulty installing software replete with several error messages, even though the setup appeared after giving the error warning to finish installing. I immediately updated the firmware so please do not tell me that the latest version of the software would have solved my problems. The instructions are confusing. Perhaps if there had been an 1. 2. 3. manual I could have made it work. I am at least nominally sophisticated. Just could not understand how to get it to work. Sorry, but it was a very bad experience. Product on its way back to Amazon after spending the afternoon as what turned to be an annoying visitor.
customer_reviews.author: Victor M. Cushing

customer_reviews.title: Extremely user unfriendly, nearly impossible to use
customer_reviews.text: Horrible user interface. Nearly impossible to access your own files. So many layers of useless security nonsense. The help choke full of their "Twonky media" garbage but NOWHERE does it tell you how to actually access the drive and the files on on the drive... DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: bnilsson

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've made in a long time
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I've made in a long time. Product worked just as seller described in description. I had no problems setting this up on my home wireless network. I also set up my smart phone to back up all pictures when on ANY wireless network. This has been a great purchase. Shipping was in a timely manner and with out any problems. Thank you very much. I would definitely purchase from seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron T

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not great
customer_reviews.text: I have this set up as the Time Machine for two Macs and it works most of the time, but really makes scene when it doesn't work. Somehow Time Machine and the WD My Book HD don't communicate super well so I end up having to create a new backup every few months. I don't know how the previous backup get corrupted or ruined so they cannot continue, but it is frustrating. Creating a new backup does take several hours. Next time, I will spend the extra money and just get the Apple Time Machine. I know it's overpriced, but I expect it will work much more seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Great little devices
customer_reviews.text: I've accumulated quite a few of these devices at various capacities. I have to say that WD have carved out a nice little niche in the NAS world. These devices are perfectly good for general-purpose network storage. But where they really shine is in their media capabilities. Combine one of these with aand you've got a great little media center. It's physically quiet and can sit right beside your television without calling attention to itself (either visually or sound-wise). Although this drive does a great job of being plug-and-play, a little network savvy will help get the most out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Personne

customer_reviews.title: died in 2 years
customer_reviews.text: i bought this exactly 2 years ago. it died a few weeks ago. prior to that it did fine, serving its purpose as network attached storage. i just noticed that the warranty is 3 years, and i suppose i can try exchanging it- what a hassle! i'm thinking of upgrading to a synology multi-bay system which would be much more robust, allow for raid storage, and let me just swap a drive without having to re-copy a ton of data. otoh, that would be a lot more expensive. so, if you want a cheap, off-the-shelf, no-assembly-required, 2 year solution, the wd my book will serve the purpose. otherwise, think about something more robust.
customer_reviews.author: J. Klugman

customer_reviews.title: Great device, Smartware difficult to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I am a Western Digital fan and buy nothing else. This particular product meets my past experience with quality, though the Smartware backup solution was very challenging to configure on this particular device. Install of the client on the PCs was slow and created a lot of errors. It is finally configured, but on two brand new Dell i7 laptops, windows 8 the install took over four hours. The system has been running for over five months mow and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MAB

customer_reviews.title: Software
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these as they were highly recommended. The units themselves are robust and sleek. I have had them a few weeks now. I am still struggling with the WD software. So, I thought I would just use Windows 7 backup software but you have to have the Profesional version on each computer on the network. After going to WD's website, it seems that the only way to schedule automatic updates is through Windows. Not sure how to do that and I'm still researching. In summary, it seems like a good choice but, if you are not computer savey, you might find it a little overwhelming. Not as "Plug & Play" as I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: dave k

customer_reviews.title: There could be something better out there.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. It doesn't have any USB Port data transfer option, so, the initial data transfer would be done through LAN. For a faster transfer rate comparable to a USB 2.0, a direct connection to your Ethernet port (that is Gigabit compliant) is necessary which can be a pain in the butt to get this device to recognize the connection. The "Safe Point Backup" is not reliable since it always is an error. However, once you get it up and running, it's reliable with very good security. I can even access it anywhere with my Windows Phone 8 with the WD2go app. It' like having my personal Cloud with 3TB of storage.
customer_reviews.author: GKO

customer_reviews.title: Frequent Failures - Avoid
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 2nd WD 2TB. The first was replaced under warranty after it stopped working. When WD replaced it (very quickly), the new device came with only the remaining time on the existing warranty (2 months remaining). Today, just as the warranty expires, I had my first failure on the new unit. It failed to connect to the network so a reboot was required. Now, the self diagnostic is hanging at the 90% mark, which is one of the symptoms of my previously failed device. It this goes the way of the first, I expect it to work intermittently for the next 90 days and then complete failure.
customer_reviews.author: wetever

customer_reviews.title: Should have done this sooner
customer_reviews.text: WOW. no more having to download and transfer pics,video,music to different devices!!!! I now share with any body, anytime. I hunt a lot, lot of hours in a deer stand, with my smart phone I can show my hunting friends pics, listen to my music, take pics and upload to the cloud and people hundreds of miles away can see them right after I shoot them. Very easy to set up and share with friends. You can people see the stuff you want them to see and not see what you don't want them to see. Every user has public and/or private storage capabilities. Very well thought out and the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: bkdk

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great within our home WiFi zone for PC's. No Macs here. We also have a Linux tower and so far, it doesn't notice the wd cloud drive. That would be very NICE if it could. One thing that could seriously improve the experience for the newbie owner of this product is a printed quick start card that ALSO indicates the various ways to access the drive once it is hooked up. The only information that comes with it just tells you how to physically connect it to your home router. You then are told to visit a website which doesn't have significantly more information than what should have been printed in the package document.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: I have this device hard-wired into my router (Gb connection) and my MacBook Pro is also hard-wired into the same router. My initial Time Machine backup went with reasonable speed, but subsequent, incremental updates to the drive started dragging. I found that if I reboot the WD MyBook Live, it works better for a period of time, but then slows down. With wired, Gb networking end-to-end the Time Machine performance should be on par with my 800Mb Firewire portable drive, but it's not even close. Even just copying files via the Mac Finder over the (wired) network to the drive is agonizingly slow.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Balky but useful
customer_reviews.text: I have two; set up one on a Mac and one on Win 7. In both cases it was simple to get them on fixed IPs and running shares. Settings would not stick without restart; this seems odd. Changing the name or IP should not require restart. Initial mount over the network seems slower than it should be; one now has 1.5 TB of data, the other under .5 TB These are set up in a gigibit Ethernet environment and are reasonably quick; they might disappoint in 10/100. iTunes server works OK; it would be nice if the units could serve a TiVo with stored movies. For low end NAS this is pretty good, and they are really inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H. Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: great little storage device
customer_reviews.text: Great little storage device. I got the 2 TB version, and couldn't be happier now that it's up and running. It took a while to copy data to it over a 100MB connection. data transfer rates appeared to be in the 5-10MB range per transfer. I discovered that concurrent file transfers all transferred at around 5-10meg each, so no throughput degradation with multiple streams of info. Now that it's up and running, I love it. boxee box sees it fine, my samsung tv sees it fine, and each of my 4 laptops sees it fine, and has great access to it...I use this for storage of pctures, videos, music, etc...and it streams files to my devices perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Much easier than setting up a full blown server just to be able to access my files remotely. Also works as a simple way to have a backup copy. Was not able to get Windows Backup to do a system image type backup, not available with Windows 7 Home. Also experienced an endless backup using WD Smartware, had to cancel it after 12 hours, delete partial backup and restart, went okay the second time. It is slow, ran the same backup, using Norton Ghost to WD MY Book and a to a USB connected portable WD drive, My Book took 5 times as long, 50 minutes vs 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: woodman

customer_reviews.title: Works great... would love a few more features though
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty easy to setup... just plug into your network and go, and has decent configurability. Would love to see a torrant downloader though built into the interface. It would also be helpful to have some documentation on how best to utilize it for iTunes, or other media applications. It works great as an iTunes server, but it would be nice if it provided some example use cases to help a user decide how best to set things up. Yes, you can Google all that information, but it would be nice if the device could step you through common use cases a bit more. If I could give this a 4.5 I would as it works great as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: P. Clemins

customer_reviews.title: Best for your money and easy to setup/use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year ago and I still love it. I use it for all of my movies and I have it networked to all my computer/Apple TV/Apple Ipad. It holds a ton of data and doesn't take much space. Only complaint is that the data transer rate is kinda lacking but it doesn't effect anything when you watch movies from your network. When you remote to it from another network/internet it is kinda slow but it all depends on your ISP and upload/download speed. I highly recommend it 3 of my friends already bought it after I showed them my set up.
customer_reviews.author: Olivasrebel

customer_reviews.title: Good and reasonable NAS
customer_reviews.text: This is the affordable NAS with good performance. Last time I combined my Asus router with WD my passport via USB. At first, it was okay and after 6 month it crashed, then I knew I need the real NAS, so I chose this. It runs 24x7 and being used by the whole family via iphone, ipad, TV. For my multimedia (movie, music, photos) and my backups (Windows 7, Windows Server). Just wish, it supports Jumbo frame for gigabit network.
customer_reviews.author: Hrusmin

customer_reviews.title: Good, fast network storage
customer_reviews.text: Using this to backup our primary PC and to serve media to our Logitech Revue. Took a bit to set up, because the included software is crap. I wound up removing the software and just using the built-in webpage configuration and it worked perfectly, so I'm still giving it 4-stars. If you don't have the Pro or better version of Windows that includes the ability to do network backups, there are a couple of good, free options that work perfectly with the drive. I'm currently using EasUS ToDo backup, but want to try the latest version of Comodo Backup and see if I like the interface better.
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Steele

customer_reviews.title: Great Personal Cloud
customer_reviews.text: Plugged right into my router and now have access to all my files from any device I have on my wifi. Just went to Germany and still had access to my files at home on the WD My Book Live through the internet. No problems with security as far as I can tell and I would trust this a lot better than a commercial cloud storage and I have no monthly fees and more than enough storage space for all my files; documents, photos, and extensive audio and videos also. I really love the personal control over any haphazard commercial system that may or may not go out of business or get compromised some day.
customer_reviews.author: jtbananas

customer_reviews.title: The Personal Cloud is working great with my cell phones for storage of videos and ...
customer_reviews.text: I found out after I made the purchase that the Ring Wi-Fi Enabled Video Doorbell can not record to it. Ring doorbell offers Cloud to save all recordings from your doorbell activity for $3 a month. I thought by buying this I could use it for the Ring and also for cell phone storage. The Personal Cloud is working great with my cell phones for storage of videos and photos.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my Win XP situation remotely
customer_reviews.text: OK, this looked to be pretty kick-butt in theroy. Got it to work as a network storage device, but the 'remote' ops sucked. I spent hours on tech support with multiple guys who didn't know too much. Had the 'offline' error. Maybe my XP was the issue, not sure. If they work out the bugs this is a great idea and could be awesome. I sent it back, time is money and I can live w/o the iphone and web-based access. Ordered a 'Buffalo' instead, we'll see. I'm probably a 7/10 in terms of IT savvy. Not super-stud nerd, but have a decent working knowledge about things.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey T.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, fast setup!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive to use as a network backup solution, as well as a shared drive in a small office environment where multiple users could access the same documents, allowing us to be certain that all pertinent files required for daily use were current and up-to-date across all systems. Added bonus – we can access the drive remotely from another computer offsite, or with our smartphones/tablet devices, giving us important documents wherever and whenever we need them. Love the drive, wish I had purchased it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Culin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: After 5 days of frustration I have to say that this device is not worth the trouble. I have called WD for assistance in establishing network connectivity, was told my issue would be moved to "level 2 support" but never heard another word. This thing is clearly not for the average computer user. Today I spent two hours trying different static IP addresses and port forwarding without results. Keep checking reviews and find better technology. If you buy this thing you are going to be disappointed. UPDATE Jan 11, 2013: I got so frustrated with the slow performance of this device that I finally unplugged it. Haven't used it in several months now.
customer_reviews.author: NorthShoreBooks

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my home entertainment
customer_reviews.text: This little NAS drive was just what I needed to stream audio to my home audio system. I was looking for something with some space to store my CD collection as flac files and this drive fits just right. The built in streaming server (Twonky) provides enough customization to fit my needs and it is the fastest that I have used to date. The add in apps (WD Photo's and WD 2go) for Android devices work well and allow me to access the drives content anytime I am connected. All this for $135 and free shipping to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product does exactly what it says. I can access my home music and video collection from all my mobile devices. I can have 45 mins at school to waste and I can pull up WD2go app on my phone and watch music videos or my favorite show to fill the time. Couldn't be more pleased with the ease of use. I had a 2 TB Personal storage device but it wasn't cloud storage. I use this cloud storage alot more than my external HDD storage since it's easily available. Great product with easy installation. A must have for a person on the go.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kelsay

customer_reviews.title: Great network backup for Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: My wife & I recently purchased new Macbook Pros and after getting them all setup, I started to think about backup solutions. Using TimeMachine, would be awesome, but I didn't want to keep connecting and disconnecting a large USB drive. I wanted something that worked over the network. A little searching led me to this. After a firmware update, this has been running like a champ with no noticeable issues. My backups go off and I see data on the drive. It's only been about 3 weeks, but I'm VERY pleased with the performance thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use with Mac
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use with Mac. Just download the software and data streams seamlessly between computer and network drive. The ability to connect remotely is also a plus as I spend a lot of time traveling as this allows me to access all this data without having to carry an external hard drive. One downside is that the MyCloud software does not display thumbnails. You can view/open files (with thumbnails) from Finder but is slower than if files were native, especially if the specific folder is large (but that's to be expected).
customer_reviews.author: Simon Dekleva

customer_reviews.title: Effective, reliable, but slow
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that will give you a lot of comfort to access your files from several sources in several ways. I have 2 laptops, 3 tablets, 3 smart phones and a WDTV Live accessing this hard disk and I've not faced any problems. be careful though to the issue of speed, yes this hard disk has 3 gigantic TB of space, but when it comes to the speed of transferring data (regardless if you accessing the hard disk directly through a LAN cable or accessing it through WIFI), the data transfer rate with this hard disk is less than 50% of the USB hard disks, not a show stopper but you should keep that in mind to avoid any disappointments.
customer_reviews.author: Bandar

customer_reviews.title: Drive fails, AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive sometime in 2010. Within a month it stopped working, so I sent it in to Western Digital, who very promptly replaced the drive. Their customer service was great and they acted fast, but the replacement, after less than a year, is now failing too. The company needs to improve the hardware or they'll keep having to replace faulty hard drives. This appears to be a common issue so I do not recommend this item because 2TB worth of data being lost is not worth the convenience of a wireless drive.
customer_reviews.author: John, CO

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 years and then drive failed. During ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 2 years and then drive failed. During power outages, it just turn off. There is no graceful shutdown physical button or nothing in software menu to shutdown. After a while of this, I believe that's what cause it not to work. I even took it to a computer shop and they couldn't recovery the data on it. I lost everything since it is a single drive. I've got a raid now with at least two drives. If you use this as your backup or NAS, consider another source of storage, such as online.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Best cloud sever
customer_reviews.text: user very unhappy all of them. I tried Pogo and it was way too slow that I got rid of it. Then I ordered an Akatio and it was faster but the hardware failed. Before buying the Western Digital I made a lot of comparisons and studied the user comments. I am very happy with the Western Digital. It acts as its own server so it works fast. Considering how fast it is coupled with a 2 TB drive and there are not monthly charges this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Richard  Field

customer_reviews.title: My Book Live 2TB
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Seagate NAS box that died. It was easy to set up and does what it is supposed to, back my computers up. The software that comes with it can automatically copy new stuff from your computers if you want it to. The included software will not make an image of your PC, so if you need that you'll have to find another program to do it. I use the free version of Macrium Reflect for this. If you aren't going to use this as a media server. be sure to turn that function off in the setup, so the drive will sleep.
customer_reviews.author: borninmo55

customer_reviews.title: Great DLNA and storage device
customer_reviews.text: I use this to stream video to my digital TV and as a general file server. This device even allows you remote access from outside the house (so you can get to your files from work or school). The DLNA server is very fast and works with my Samsung digital TV. The ONLY down side is the DLNA server doesn't show icons of the video (like my Samsung server did, on the other hand it never hangs like my Samsung did). Overall I strongly recommend this device, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Slow and buggy
customer_reviews.text: Worst external HD I've ever had. Upload/download speeds are horrendous. For example, I started uploading 512 MB of pictures about 3 hours ago, and it's only about 60% complete. That's about 30 KB/s transfer rate. It should be capable of at least 100x that!! Do a Google search and you will see that many people have the exact same problem. The kicker is that WD has done absolutely nothing about it. Besides that, the user interface is clunky, remote access works less than 50% of the time, and file permissions are frequently corrupted. I will never buy another WD product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pechette

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 1TB version for a few years prior to getting this one. When the PC board went out in the old drive, I picked this up as a replacement. Setup was simple, and the ability to configure different access for different users is a nice feature. Plus, the ability to access files over the internet helps out a lot. I'm a pro photographer, so having the ability to access 2TB of space remotely is wonderful. I can shoot all day, download to my laptop, then make a backup copy on the hard drive sitting in my office, even when on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Never worked as cloud
customer_reviews.text: This device never worked as a cloud server. The software provided always gave useless feedback about nonexistent error conditions when trying to set it up. Because I initially bought the device to serve as an NFS, I decided not to pursue correction through their Byzantine help system. The drive still works as an NFS on my ethernet LAN but over time the status light has begun to blink and never go solid green. Western Digital has a good name so I am surprised at the poor quality of their support.
customer_reviews.author: John Bollenbacher

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but good value
customer_reviews.text: I've had this NAS for about 7 months. It was very easy to set up and has worked very well as a backup device for my home network. One of the main reasons I purchased this NAS was for remote access. Retrieving a file from the NAS when away from home can be very handy. According to LAN Speed Test, write speeds are about 90 Mbps and read speeds are about 115 Mpbs between the NAS and a laptop connected to my network wirelessly. Of course, remote access speed is limited by upload speeds of my ISP.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fanning

customer_reviews.title: It Does What It Advertises
customer_reviews.text: Setup is fairly easy but gets a bit technical for some. The ability to archive my own data and access it from anywhere is great for me. My one complaint is that there is no USB connection to be able to back the information up directly, all transfers must be done over the network which slows the process down a bit. Still, a great and relatively cost effective option for backing your data up and having it readily available anywhere you go.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Love love love~
customer_reviews.text: This device is miraculous. I use it for both work and for play, thanks to the privacy settings. I haven't figured out how to access them from my HDTV, but I can link up with my desktop, my laptop, my Iphone, and my Asus tablet. It does take a bit of fiddling at first, and you definitely need a hardwire CAT5 into the router to get it to work wirelessly. But this thing has been a godsend since I installed an SSD into my desktop with limited memory. It's like Shangri-La up in my network ri'nawwww~
customer_reviews.author: Ana Morozoff

customer_reviews.title: It works.. and then it doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to this and figured that a Western Digital product would be good, since they make great hard drives. Not so much with this though. I followed the connection directions, easy and clear. My Mybook Live worked for a day, then the next day it stopped, so I spent two days trying to get it to work again, and it did, then the next day it stopped working again. It doesn't seem very reliable to me, I am returning it and getting a non network WD drive, there is something glitchy in the network version.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mardall

customer_reviews.title: great personal server, good value
customer_reviews.text: A great personal server, if speed is not a great concern. It checked out to work properly with windows clients (Win98, 2000, Xp, and Win7). The management web page is simple, though slow. (cookie must be allowed ). It is must easier to use and less hassle than using a 'home server', though not sure how secure it is, comparing to a home server with encrypted drives. Shares are broken down into Public, Private, and Internet accessible ones.
customer_reviews.author: chairman@en63

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FOR MACBOOK! What a waste of $
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews prior to selecting and purchasing this product, and felt that the ones that had issues may have been from people who are not too savvy with computers. Please don't make the same mistake. I've spent months trying to get this overpriced paperweight working and after reading hundreds of threads, talking to WD support, trying one fix after another, I've finally given up. Only to find out my window for returning the item has expired. What a frustrating experience. I've always liked WD, but this just doesn't work with MacBooks (I'm on OS X Lion).
customer_reviews.author: LMM

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose - setup challenging
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the unit to provide my personal cloud since I have various computers and wireless devices that I wanted to have common access to files and information. It works fine for that purpose. That said, initial setup was a bit challenging. WD provides a dedicated consierge service to help with that and I would encourage using it, not only for initial set up but also for mapping the unit as a hard drive etc. Overall a good product, just be prepared to spend some time on the front end setup.
customer_reviews.author: E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: This drive just stopped working after 8 months. It worked perfectly fine up until then, and I liked the web interface, user control, etc., but now I've lost all my files that were on that drive. Luckily I keep my photo library in the cloud (that word is getting so old, someone needs to make a new one) but my movies and music are all gone. I probably could have had it replaced, but I jumped the gun and opened it up. Tried connecting it via SATA and no luck. It now lives in the dump.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but software is ill conceived
customer_reviews.text: This works, but the software is very poorly done unless you just do the basics. You have no easy way to make sure that it works in a secure way. In addition, the documentation does not provide any information about the protocols in use, so it is difficult to integrate it with a home network. I found the best help on Linux hack sites. The idea is good, and this could be fixed if they got an experienced developer who knows how to develop interfaces (human and machine).
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work properly with TimeMachine
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Mac and use TimeMachine, I would not recommend this product. Or probably any other NAS aside from TimeCapsule. I kept getting messages that something was corrupt and that I would have to delete all my backups and start a new backup. First time, I didn't mind, but it keeps showing up more and more frequently, defeating the purpose of sequential backups. I now use a WD passport, which has been just fine.
customer_reviews.author: KSG

customer_reviews.title: Do not use it!
customer_reviews.text: It does not work with windows 10 and the software is outdated. I almost lost 10 years of data and spent 5 days with different WD techs trying to access the drive. Avoid at all cost
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin de Estrada

customer_reviews.title: This SLAM is on Western Digital; It was VERY ...
customer_reviews.text: This SLAM is on Western Digital; It was VERY DISAPPOINTING to learn that this device had only a 1-year shelf life that expired just for sitting on a shelf too long. It was New but no warranty came with it when it was finally purchased. What; is WD too cheap to extend it? Who'd-a-thunk shopping for a can of peas would find us ending up in the produce aisle!
customer_reviews.author: Fixer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Access on the Go
customer_reviews.text: I have a ton of hard drives, but I bought this hard drive so all my music can sync to one place without removing my passport drive each time. It is easy to set up as well. Once you download all of the firmware, you can access files on your phone and remotely anywhere. It's a pretty neat feature to have. I can access any file from anywhere at 100mbps or whatever I can max out on the incoming internet connection. It has tons of added security of you want that feature which is easy to set up as well.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've had NAS drives in the past... a real pain to set up and maintain. WD has gotten this one right. Easy automated set-up, no problems connecting all the networked computers to it as well as the i-phone and android phones. I do wish they had a bit more documentation shipped with drive on manual set-up... but I assume most people will just plug it in and let it install. So far it has been running over a week, with no lock-ups or re-boots Cannot be beat for the money.............
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: wd my book
customer_reviews.text: I have had the product only a week or so and there is no issue with it. However, I am lowering the rating because (1) there were no instructions at all on installation (2) there was suppose to be a 3 year warranty and when I registered it there was only 27 months given to me - still trying to resolve that issue. (3) the phone number given for tech support doesn't work (4) too much time taken to try to resolve warranty issue and to get an instruction manual
customer_reviews.author: rich from mich

customer_reviews.title: Value and Function
customer_reviews.text: The drive functions exactly as it should with one caveat. It takes forever to load into the shares the first time after a computer restart or a network reboot. Seriously it took like 2 minutes for it to load in my primary share. It needs more processing power or RAM but for simple filestorage on my network without software it is adequate. Knocked off 1 star for speed but everything else is as intended. Don't hesitate, the drive speeds for transfer are great. Will probably make a a good storage drive on a desktop (possibly 7200 rpm with a large cache) if you popped it out of it's enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: After more than a year it gets non functional.
customer_reviews.text: It was impossible to recuperate a lot of information I had on the disk. I decided not to buy or use any more ot these devices from that company
customer_reviews.author: Der alte Peter

customer_reviews.title: High-quality, quiet Network Drive
customer_reviews.text: A very good unit with plenty of space for my purposes. Sits right on my desk and runs whisper quiet. I use Norton Security Suite for automatic continuous backup, which gives me some peace of mind. Would qualify for 5 stars if the network set up was more intuitive. Maybe that's not all WD's fault, since I'm a Microsoft home user. I would put in a good word for the WD help folks, who were responsive and pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tenser

customer_reviews.title: Customer Support is Not Very Good
customer_reviews.text: It took me weeks to learn how to use MBL to any reasonable level. I have many questions about what happens when I add files that I would like answered. But I have not been successful in getting answers from WD. For example, when I add files to MBL, why does it take hours (overnight) to have the files appear on my DLNA devices. Clicking on RESCAN or REBUILD under SETTINGS does not seem to help. What is happening that takes so long? I have tried to connect with WD Support via email/phone but since they will not use a proper CALLER ID, I never can answer when they call. Now I can't even log in?
customer_reviews.author: John Rolin

customer_reviews.title: Good drive for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've has this drive for about 6 months now. It was pretty easy to set up and has been for the most part hassle free. I primarily use the drive to store photos, videos, etc that I want to share across my home network. I also saved my Firefox and Thunderbird profiles to the drive, so I can access from any computer in the house. I wanted to write this review primarily because I didn't think this drive warranted a 1 star rating that I've seen a lot of. Not a one star product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall D. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Not so reliable
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 5 stars if I hadn't needed to call their tech support to resolve a start up issue that asked for a non-existant password. Update: July 2013 It is taking a long time to back-up with my MB Pro. Sometimes the back-ups fail and restart. Customer support should be free. I wonder how many people, who own this product, wonder if their back-ups are occurring and are useable, in the event of a crash.
customer_reviews.author: JMCalifornia

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it but Speeds are horrible
customer_reviews.text: On paper this Drive has it all. Remote access, itunes,mac support, space, everything. I tried to ignore all the bad reviews on speed and figured how bad could it really be. It is horrible. I was getting under 10Mbps transfer rate using cat6 cable via my verizon router. Transferring large amounts of data would take me forever. I just can't live with this kind of a system. Back to Amazon it is and i'll have to keep shopping around. Such a shame.
customer_reviews.author: chulo15157

customer_reviews.title: Works great, as long as you fix it first
customer_reviews.text: Truly wonderful device. Even reads UDF (.iso) files, so I can watch them through my WD TV Live device. Only one MAJOR problem. You must immediately fix the hard drive timeout settings, otherwise you unit will soon die. First, update the device, since updates will likely erase everything other than your files in the /shared directory. Then you'll need to enable SSH (save settings, edit the savefile, load settings). Then download, compile, and run the binary. If you don't like using a Linux command line, find someone who does or skip this product.
customer_reviews.author: packrat0x

customer_reviews.title: Western digital my Book live Review
customer_reviews.text: I have had the my book live for about a week. I called western digital to help be hook it up. It took about ten minutes. I used it just for my music collecton on my two computers. I have about 500 cds half on each computer. I used my own programs. Such back up etc. I use the j River music program. It works perfect with my book. I had a few files on my computer. They were also filed in my book. I am no expert with computers.
customer_reviews.author: Bw

customer_reviews.title: hours of troubleshooting with tech support
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours on the phone with Western Digital support to get this working. I couldn't connect to the private shares. I had changed the name of the admin account. Lesson learned: leave the "admin" account alone. That account will let you login into the web interface. Create another user account with a different password with permissions to the private shares.
customer_reviews.author: David McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: It does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: I have not maximized this device yet, but that's ok, I am growing into it... having all my large files on it such as music and photos sure helps keep my pc's hard drive from crossing that 80% filled point that in turn causes sluggish responce from the computer because of the disruption from the psuedo-multitasking that windows performs. Now if online services could be as reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne J. Villines

customer_reviews.title: Became non-responsive after 30 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay as a backup drive and occasional DLNA, until it abruptly dropped off line in late December 2015 after 30 months of 24 x 7 service. No amount of coaxing has been able to persuade the front indicator light to turn green and acknowledge network requests. Fortunately, most of the material stored on the backup drive is still available on the three networked work stations it supports, so my loss is largely one of time recollecting and organizing the data I wanted backed up. I think the machine has a 3 year warranty, but whether I want to trust my data to this kind of device is another matter.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Easton

customer_reviews.title: SO far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few weeks now backing up my MacBookPro using Time Machine. I, thankfully, have never needed to actually use it to restore items but so far, the thing is backing up all of my material at the right time and without impeding the use of my machine. We have yet to add another computer's backups, but that is the next test. Also, setting it up was beyond easy. I can't speak for how this works with a PC yet, but so far, pretty flawless with a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Irizarry

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. The cloud storage works as advertised and I have had no problem setting it up. It streams media to my smart tv, PS3, and other dnla enabled devices on my network easily and was very easy to setup. Just plug it into your router,make sure upnp is enabled and enjoy easy streaming of almost 3 TB of media. Very satisfied with this product and recommend it to all my friends. Also it was very easy to set my android phone as a device with access to stream my music and videos.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust it with your important files
customer_reviews.text: We bought one right after our son did. By the time we got ours, his had already died, and he had put all of his files on it. He lost everything! Fortunately, almost a month later, he got his files back from data recovery company, but they were jumbled and unnamed so he only had the unit for about 2 weeks and will have several months of work ahead of him to really restore his files. I would NOT recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: F N PV

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient personal cloud storage.
customer_reviews.text: I can access files from anywhere without having my computer turned on. The software is easy to use and setup. The bonus is that it has an MyCloud app for iOS and I think Android too. The app is amazing and also allows you add your dropbox account to access both your personal cloud My Book and what ever is on your dropbox, very convenient. The only problem is shared files/folders are slow to download for whomever you share them to.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: I don't know what all the negative reviews are about
customer_reviews.text: This is a great storage device, for the money. Not only is the 2TB a lot of storage, but you can access your files from anywhere in the world, with you computer, tablet, or phone. For example, while staying in a hotel in Hong Kong, I streamed a movie from this device to my tablet. The device was in the basement of my home in Washington, DC, about 12,000 miles away, and I had no problem watching the movie.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this drive well over a month ago and, to date, still cannot get remote access setup so that I can use it as my personal cloud drive and access my info from someplace beyond my home network. I keep requesting assistance from WD but apparently their customer support is non existent. The drive is useful to me as a network storage device and all computers in my home can access it but I really needed it to be a "cloud" device.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hiemenz

customer_reviews.title: Product Failed, WD Wants you to PAY for Shipping Back
customer_reviews.text: Word to the wise: Keep your packaging for as long as humanly possible, because you never know when your product will go belly-up. In the case of my WD drive, it began failing 4 days ago after less than 2 months on the job. It was returned today, but to add insult to injury, because I had to return it to Western Digital instead of Amazon (didn't keep the packaging, unfortunately), WD makes you PAY for shipping the item. Last time I ever buy a WD product, ever.
customer_reviews.author: SoPasGal

customer_reviews.title: Cloud? Not really
customer_reviews.text: It's great if you're only staying home. I'm finding it difficult at best to use as a personal cloud. Also, WD's customer service was horrific on the five plus occasions I attempted to call them. I'm also fairly good at tech. I've managed tech well on many platforms for thirty years. If I'm having an issue, I can only image what's happening for other. Nice as a backup drive but other than that, I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Gross

customer_reviews.title: didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fairly tech-savvy guy, and I could not get this thing to be seen on my network without disabling all security which makes it rather pointless. Apparently a lot of other people have had this problem. The product is terrible in my opinion, but the seller was great and gave me a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Evolution Media

customer_reviews.title: Great drive, easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: After recieving this drive I was able to hook it up to the house network via the router and get it up and running within a few minutes. The ability to back up large amounts of data as well as the ability to access that data while away via the app on my iPhone is great. I am thinking about purchasing a second one purely to provide a redundant backup to the first, since the price is so manageable.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Drive
customer_reviews.text: Before I ordered this drive I was concerned because of all of the negative reviews. I am not saying they are not accurate but if they are, WD has really improved this drive. Setup was a breeze. It makes no noise at all and it is blazingly fast! I will update if and when the drive starts to fail - but so far very satisfied with this investment.
customer_reviews.author: S Vegors

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are wrong
customer_reviews.text: This product is good... Speed is way better then described, and I had no problems at all... As far as i'm concerned, I have no complaints at all...It is performing exactly the way I wanted... These reviewers are to picky... I've had other products with way more glitchy problems...A+
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy Setup (2013 with updates) and Decent Speed
customer_reviews.text: I've got this little NAS connected over a gigabit router and ran the initial setup process. It was very simple. My BlackMagic Disk Speed Test yielded roughly 30 MB/s write and 100 MB/s read over the wired network. Wirelessly, I only managed ~25 MB/s write and read. This may be more indicative of a shortcoming on my network setup. I'll be investigating this and reporting back later. I'm currently transfer 1.4 TB of data over and OSX estimates 18 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This drive is very useful. I have a Linksys Gigabit router connected to this drive, a Netgear Digital Entertainer Plus and a WD Media Player Plus. I stream the media files flawlessly to both of the media players, as well as our laptops on occasion. Transfer speeds are good while hard wired to PC, Wireless transfer is a little slow but that can't be helped. It could be better is it had a USB 2.0/3.0 or esata port for faster/alternate transferring.
customer_reviews.author: James Dennis Nowlan

customer_reviews.title: slow
customer_reviews.text: a very slow server. I wound up returning it to amazon and went with one from synology for a little more. Much faster and more reliable. This one had overheating issues when faced with large file transfers. Poor design, I should have listened to the other reviews but I took a chance because the price point was so good.
customer_reviews.author: morepowa

customer_reviews.title: Great - Works as desired!
customer_reviews.text: Bad reviews are based upon people with unreasonable expectations. I don't know of any drive at this price that can stream hd movies. You need a dedicated pc for that. We use this as a home backup with of photos stored on multiple computers and smartphones. It works great automatically backing up Droid phones, but not iPhones (as of my knowledge). My wife makes me check periodically that her phone is automatically backed up and it is! We have the drive set to backup with Crashplan and everything works great. I wish it would automatically back up iPhone photos though.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J. Inkell

customer_reviews.title: Another Brick on the wall
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two. Like many others, one of mine started having issues after a forced update right out of the box. If you have critical data, you might want to consider another option. This device has no active cooling and putting it on a shelf might not provide enough airflow to keep it cool enough to maintain availability. I would not buy this item again.. I refuse to return the bad one since in now contains personal info.. I'll disassemble it and just use the drive. One of the two I purchased is still working but I purchased a competitive device so I could back up my data for when this one bricks also.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Eubank

customer_reviews.title: Simple to Use, Takes long to transfer documents
customer_reviews.text: The set up was a breeze but transfering files takes forever. I transferred 15,000 photos and it took about 8 hours. And when it was done I noticed not all of them had transfered. Since then, I've pretty much given up. I like things that are fast and don't require so much effort. I don't know if there is anything wrong with the product or if that's the normal for transfering things but so far, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: E. solis

customer_reviews.title: Bought this about 2 years ago and it's still holding ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about 2 years ago and it's still holding strong. Use it daily since I got it. It connects with a Ethernet cable so you will need to have a Ethernet port available or buy a small 5 port switch to use with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Sluggish Performance, runs hot, failed after less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Very weak processor leads to sluggish performance when trying to browse the contents of the drive or restore files. The unit runs quite hot, so I was always careful to leave lots of space around it to help dissipate the heat. Unfortunately, the drive died after 22 months (won't boot up and is inaccessible from the PC.) Not recommended. I had much better luck with my 2 TB WD MyBook USB.
customer_reviews.author: Ski Dude

customer_reviews.title: Works great even without the software
customer_reviews.text: Unless you know nothing about networking, backing up your files, I recommend not installing all its associated automated backup software and either use a package you are comfortable with or simply as a drag and drop file exchange on your network. Slight lag while waking up but it sure beats having a pc as a backup server and all its associated maintenance. Once its awake and running, great NAS! Made my life much easier.
customer_reviews.author: DanTanna

customer_reviews.title: DLNA issue.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for its DLNA capability. But unfortunately did not work. I have a LG TV and Windows 7 laptop and none of them could connect the DLNA server in this box. Called level 2 support and they failed to connect too. You can connect via the browser but movie streaming breaks after some time. Wanted to love this product but had to return. 3 stars just for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Kunkle

customer_reviews.title: Easy file server, easy internet connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: Although I was very wary buying this product due to mixed reviews, I will say that set up and usability is really great and everything I had hoped for. I have had WD Books fail on me suddenly before, so read negative reviews before buying. But, I am happily sharing files among my home network and over the internet very easily. Happy for now.
customer_reviews.author: patrick808

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I can never have enough storage and with this 3TB network drive I can move alot more freely around my home to view .....my files.... also able to share them with the rest of the family with multiple computers or phones and tablets this is the 4th WD My book that I have gotten and its the best addition to my network and my need of storage. I would Recommend this to all of my Fellow computer geeks and anyone else who needs alot of storage like I do with my total of 8TB
customer_reviews.author: juan hernandez

product_meta.title: WD My Book Live 1TB Personal Cloud Storage NAS Share Files and Photos
product_meta.description:
Size:1 TBSimplify your digital life by consolidating your movies, music, photos, and files in one location for everyone on your wired or wireless network to share with a Western Digital My Book Live Network-Attached Storage drive.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MY BOOK® LIVE™ PERSONAL CLOUD STORAGE - SHARED STORAGE FOR COMPUTERS, TABLETS, AND SMARTPHONES.
Connect this powerful drive to your wireless router for shared storage on your home network that you can access within and outside the home. Share files with Mac computers and PCs, stream media to your television through your DLNA™-enabled devices, and access files remotely with the WD 2go app and website.

Create your own personal cloud.
Access your files at home or away with your Mac®, PC, smartphone and iPad®. Stream videos, music, and photos to your connected TV, game console or media player. Centralized storage and wireless backup.
Connect the drive to your wireless router to provide shared storage and wireless backup for all the PC and Mac computers on your home network. Brawn and brains for all your applications.
A built-in, high-powered CPU gives you the horsepower you need for the most demanding applications. Stream media seamlessly and transfer files without skipping a beat. Features at a glance
 * Storage and backup for PC and Mac computers
 * Remote access and apps for your mobile devices
 * Stream media to your entertainment center
 * Built-in 800 MHz CPU for uncompromising speed
 * 3-year limited warranty 

Your media and files on your own personal cloud - Create your own personal cloud, without the monthly fees and mysterious location of your data. Store your media and files on the drive and access them securely over the Internet with any PC or Mac computer. Or, use WD's mobile apps for easy access with your tablet or smartphone. It's like having up to 3 TB of extra storage for your mobile device.

Now streaming to your HDTV - Watch your daughter's birthday party video or show off your vacation slideshow on your TV. The built-in media server streams music, photos and movies to any DLNA-certified multimedia device such as a WD TV Live network media player, Blu-ray Disc™ player, Xbox 360®, PlayStation® 3, and connected TV. DLNA 1.5 & UPnP™ certified.

Shared storage for all your computers - Now you can store your entire family's movies, music, photos, and important files to one place for everyone in the home to share. Just plug the drive into your wireless router so that you can store and access files with any PC or Mac computer in your home.

Automatic, wireless backup for all your computers - Protect your precious memories and wirelessly back up all the PC and Mac computers on your network to one reliable location. Windows users can use the included WD SmartWare software and every time you save something, it's instantly backed up. Mac users can utilize all the features of Apple® Time Machine™ backup software to protect their data.

Speed without compromise - Built with an 800 MHz CPU for maximum performance to power all your applications from streaming to remote access. Designed around the most recent advances in Ethernet chip technology, this product delivers best-in-class read speeds faster than traditional USB 2.0 drives.

Serve up your music with iTunes® - The drive includes iTunes server support so you can centralize your music and video collection and stream it to any Mac or PC with iTunes.

Easy to set up, easy to find on your network- Set up is a snap. In just a few minutes, you're up and running. Mac, Windows® 7, and Windows Vista® computers will automatically find your My Book Live drive in seconds. If you're running Windows XP, our simple discovery software makes it easy to set up the drive.

Ideal for

 * Storing your digital media collection on your wired or wireless network
 * Sharing videos, music, and photos with all the computers on your network
 * Backing up data from all the PCs and Mac computers in your home
 * Viewing photos and files with your iPhone®, iPad®, iPod touch®, or Android™ smartphone
 * Streaming media to your Blu-ray Disc™ players, game consoles, media players, or other DNLA/UPnP devices on your home network

What's in the box
Network drive, Ethernet cable, AC power adapter, Installation and software CD, Quick Install Guide.

Compatibility
Windows XP (SP3), Windows Vista, Windows 7
Mac OS® X Leopard or Snow Leopard
DLNA/UPnP enabled devices

For more great WD products, visit the Western Digital Store at Amazon.com



Home Network Storage
Comparison Chart My Book Live My Book Live Duo Shared storage for computers, tablets and smartphones. Dual-drive shared storage for computers, tablets and smartphones.
